scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You responded by suggesting breaking the tasks into smaller parts. The team seemed somewhat relieved but still on edge. [Monica] and [Bob] exchange concerned looks. Monica then speaks up, 'Even with smaller tasks, the deadline is still too tight.' Bob, looking frustrated, adds, 'I don't think anyone here believes we can actually pull this off.' You then acknowledged the team's feelings and opened the floor for discussion. Monica sighed and mentioned that discussing concerns won't expand the deadline. Bob muttered that the situation felt like a disaster waiting to happen. You then encouraged the team to stay focused and do their best. Monica, looking exasperated, said that staying focused is one thing but they still have a mountain of work and no extra hands. Bob, crossing his arms, stated maybe they should just accept failure. You encouraged the team to stay focused and organized. Now, Monica, slumping in her chair, says, 'This is just too much. We're going to burn out at this rate.'
scenes.description: Bob, shaking his head, says, 'Monica's right. We can't keep this pace up without some serious consequences.'

options.text: I hear you both. Let's split the workload into shifts so no one is overburdened. We need to take care of ourselves too.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's concerns and proposed a practical solution, demonstrating empathy and good social skills.

options.text: I know it's hard, but we need to power through. If we all pull our weight, we'll get through this.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay focused and work together, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: If anyone has a more efficient way to manage this, I'm all ears. Otherwise, let's buckle down and get it done.
options.analysis: You opened the floor for suggestions but also pushed the team to continue working, showing moderate emotion perception and self-regulation.
